docs.snippet: A look at some of the ads designed by Russia to exploit divisions in American society and to tip the 2016 election in favor of Donald J. Trump.

headline.print_headline: These Are the Ads Russia Bought on Facebook in 2016
headline.main: These Are the Ads Russia Bought on Facebook in 2016

docs.snippet: Facebook said it was planning to roll out a new tool so you can figure out whether the page or account you followed or liked was run by Russian agents.

headline.print_headline: Facebook to Help Identify Victims of Propaganda
headline.main: Were You a Victim of Russian Propaganda? Facebook Will Help You Find Out

docs.snippet: The ability to aim a message at a particular audience has been a crucial marketing tool, but may be at odds with laws against bias in hiring.

headline.print_headline: Targeted Job Ads on Facebook Prompt Concerns About Age Bias
headline.main: Facebook Job Ads Raise Concerns About Age Discrimination

docs.snippet: The social media platform has become a hub for rampant misinformation on reproductive rights.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Is Ignoring Anti-Abortion Fake News
headline.main: Facebook Is Ignoring Anti-Abortion Fake News

docs.snippet: If everyone is upset with you, as the platform’s chief says, are you really doing something right?
Technologists, academics, politicians and journalists suggested ways to improve Facebook — as a product, a company or both.

headline.print_headline: How to Fix Facebook? We Asked 9 Experts
headline.main: How to Fix Facebook? We Asked 9 Experts

docs.snippet: British lawmakers are investigating whether Moscow influenced the 2016 referendum. The social media giants have promised information within weeks.

headline.main: Facebook and Twitter Promise to Aid Inquiry on Russian Brexit Meddling

docs.snippet: An advice columnist says think twice before setting up a Facebook app for pre-teenagers.
Some parents welcomed Messenger Kids, the tech giant’s first major foray into connecting children under 13 to its services, but others worried about social media’s deeper intrusion.

headline.print_headline: Text and Chat (if It’s O.K. With Mom and Dad)
headline.main: New Facebook App for Children Ignites Debate Among Families

docs.snippet: As pressure grows on the social media giant, there are no easy answers to dealing with posts that get promoted by its many users.

headline.print_headline: Tussle Within Facebook Focuses on How to Address Misleading Material
headline.main: At Facebook, Hand-Wringing Over a Fix for Fake Content
